title: How to Make a Naked Egg

steps.headline: Place the egg in a tall glass, jar, or a plastic cup and fill the glass with white vinegar, submerging the egg.
Leave the egg in the vinegar for a full 24 hours.
steps.description: Look closely. Do you see any bubbles forming on the shell? To see the best reaction place your face above the egg.

steps.headline: Change the vinegar on the second day.
steps.description: Carefully pour the old vinegar down the drain and cover the egg with fresh vinegar. But remember, use a strainer to catch the egg so it does not fall down the drain. Place the glass with the vinegar and egg in a safe place for 1 day-   Don't disturb the egg, but pay close attention the bubbles forming on the surface of the shell (or what's left of it).

steps.headline: Pour off the vinegar and carefully rinse the egg with water.
steps.description: The egg now looks translucent because the outside shell is gone! The only thing that remains is the delicate membrane of the egg!

steps.headline: Remember to take pictures day by day of the egg and take notes!
